intro: Astracantha garaensis, commonly known as the Garaensis milkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. Astracantha garaensis is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
